DataElement.preferredName: Positive Surgical Margin Resection Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not a resection was done when a surgical margin was positive.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Positive Finding Surgical Margin Excision Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism._One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.:One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.

Property.preferredDefinition: Removal or excision by surgical measures.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements of a patient's surgical margins.
